intro: Ipomoea barnesii, commonly known as the Barnes's morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that typically bloom in the morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces vines that can climb or trail along the ground. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ipomoea barnesii is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other damp habitats.
